system.description: Often wear magical full plate armor.
system.appearance: Appears as a human, or other species, but with wings.

overview.base: Armor you wear does not interfere with your ability to use abilities gained from mage classes.

Bless Self in a ritual that improves your Divine Gift. It follows the same rules as that ritual, but allows you to revise and strengthen that ritual's effects. Remind the GM of the effects of your Divine Gift, as they determine the effects of this ritual.
Note: Keep track of your original Divine Gift's effects. If you loose or become incapable of Bless Self, your Divine Gift returns to the state it was in before. If you loose or become incapable of Divine Gift, then you loose the effects of Bless Self.

value.variable: You may sacrifice any amount of mana as a part of this ritual.
You may sacrifice any amount of health as a part of this ritual.

costs.materialCost: You may sacrifice any material components as a part of this ritual, but you must have a symbol of your deity present.

system.requirements: You already have a Divine Gift. This ritual can typically be used only once.

overview.base:
Divine Gift is a ritual that allows you to call upon their deity for a blessing. As part of this ritual, you make a sacrifice to your deity. You can decide exactly what this sacrifice entails. It may be MP, HP, magical items, vows of service, or anything else that you and your GM agree upon. Once the sacrifice is complete, your GM determines the blessing your deity grants you.
Note: Although a short rest is the standard amount of time it takes to perform this ritual, you may choose to spend more or less time on it. Your GM will choose how your deity interprets this.
Note: While some deities may be interested in a large sacrifice, others may be more interested in the intent behind it. Your Divine Gift ritual should be tailored towards what your deity values. You are free to request something specific in your sacrifice, but your deity may choose to grant you something else.
Note: The blessing granted by your deity may have flaws or unexpected consequences.
Note: Although this ability is sustained, you do not need to re-execute Divine Gift to regain its effects if you temporarily become incapable of it.

value.variable: You may sacrifice any amount of mana as a part of this ritual.
You may sacrifice any amount of health as a part of this ritual.

costs.materialCost: You may sacrifice any material components as a part of this ritual, but you must have a symbol of your deity present.

system.requirements: This ritual can typically be used only once.

overview.base: You fly at half speed.
overview.proficient: You instead fly at full speed.

overview.base: You go Ethereal or manifest back into the Material Realm.

results.hit: Target heals at the start of their next turn.

overview.base: You are immune to non-magic damage.

At the start of each of your turns, you warded revitalize and regain that many MP. This does not consume your mana die. If you were dead, this brings you back to life with the number of MP you rolled and 1 HP. You only die due to MP loss if you start your turn without successfully regenerating MP.

system.limitation: Can only revitalize MP spent on divinely powered abilities.

overview.base: At the start of each of your turns, you warded heal and regain that many HP. This does not consume your hit die. If you were dead, this brings you back to life with the number of HP you rolled and 1 MP. You only die due to HP loss if you start your turn without successfully regenerating HP.
Target spell fizzles.

system.requirements: Target is a conjured spell.
system.trigger: A conjured spell is used within range.
system.improvement: Does not affect spells you cast.

overview.base: Target spell fizzles, as do any others cast simultaneously within range. Their casters take the spells' effects instead.

system.requirements: Target is a conjured spell.
system.trigger: A conjured spell is used within range.
system.improvement: Does not affect spells you cast.

overview.proficient: If target is undead, they are healed for Damage P times.
overview.fluent: If target is undead, they are healed for Damage F times.

results.hit: If target is dead, they are brought back to life. If they had less than 1 HP, they have 1 HP. If they had less than 1 MP, they have 1 MP. Otherwise, their HP and MP do not change. If target is undead, you can choose to have them be healed for Damage.

system.heightened: For each additional MP spent, target can have been dead for an additional 10 minutes. If target is undead, they are healed an additional time.
system.requirements: Target is undead or has died within the last 10 minutes.

overview.base:
You may block with a BV equal to your AV for the purpose of Shattering Armor.
Note: This does not allow you to delivery other blocks in this way.

results.save: Equipment that delivers attack you block becomes shattered.

overview.base: You can block non-warded UB attacks with your shields. Any effects that would turn off or cut through resistances affect this as well.
You gain Giant Strength and Shattering Grip. In addition, you may deboost any melee weapon attack to make it AV0.
You gain Improved Strength and Melee Damage Boost. In addition, you are no longer suffer the consequences of cumbersome items.
You gain Beastly Strength and Improved Armor Piercing.

Can wield two-handed weapons in one hand.
Note: AP weapons must still be wielded in two hands to be AV0.
Melee weapons you use are armor piercing.
You may spend an unused action to boost the triggering damage.
overview.proficient: You may spend an additional unused action to boost the triggering damage again.

system.trigger: You have hit a creature with a damaging melee weapon attack.
